org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.async

Class AsyncLearning<O extends Encodable,A,AS extends ActionSpace<A>,NN extends NeuralNet>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.Learning<O,A,AS,NN>
      • org.deeplearning4j.rl4j.learning.async.AsyncLearning<O,A,AS,NN>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILearning<O,A,AS>, NeuralNetFetchable<NN>, StepCountable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    A3CDiscrete, AsyncNStepQLearningDiscrete

    public abstract class AsyncLearning<O extends Encodable,A,AS extends ActionSpace<A>,NN extends NeuralNet>
extends Learning<O,A,AS,NN>
    The entry point for async training. This class will start a number (configuration.getNumThread()) of worker threads. Then, it will monitor their progress at regular intervals (see setProgressEventInterval(int))
    Author:
    rubenfiszel (ruben.fiszel@epfl.ch) 7/25/16., Alexandre Boulanger

      This method will train the model The training stop when:
      - A worker thread terminate the AsyncGlobal thread (see AsyncGlobal)

      Listeners

        public int getStepCounter()
        Returns:

      • train

        public void train()
        This method will train the model

        The training stop when:
        - A worker thread terminate the AsyncGlobal thread (see AsyncGlobal)
        OR
        - a listener explicitly stops it

        Listeners
        For a given event, the listeners are called sequentially in same the order as they were added. If one listener returns TrainingListener.ListenerResponse.STOP, the remaining listeners in the list won't be called.
        Events:

        • onTrainingStart() is called once when the training starts.
        • onTrainingEnd() is always called at the end of the training, even if the training was cancelled by a listener.

      • monitorTraining

        protected void monitorTraining()

        protected void cleanupPostTraining()
